findings.title: Inadequate checkpoints for withdrawERC20Token() function.
findings.description: The withdrawERC20Token() function allows the admin to pass in any token address and initiate a transfer without ensuring the contract has sufficient balance for the specific token address, which may lead to invalid token addresses being passed as arguments.

findings.title: Redundant comparisons to boolean Constants
findings.description: Boolean constants can directly be used in conditional statements or require statements. Therefore, it's not considered a better practice to explicitly use TRUE or FALSE in the require statements.

findings.title: Invalid function name found in BridgeBscDev contract
findings.description: The BridgeBscDev contract includes a function with an invalid name withdrawERC20Token() as ERC20 tokens standards are available only on the Ethereum blockchain and not on Binance smart chain.

findings.title: NatSpec Annotations must be included
findings.description: The smart contracts do not include the NatSpec annotations adequately.

findings.title: Unlocked Pragma statements found in the contracts
findings.description: The contracts include unlocked pragma solidity version statements which might lead to accidental deployment to a version with unfixed bugs.
